title: Drawing, "Male Head, Bowed to Right"
description: This is a view of a male head positioned downward on the shoulders. Moderately heavy lines define the facial features: eyebrows slanting upward and meeting at the nose; eyes looking downward; in the forehead, a curved, v-shaped furrow jutting out from a straight, long nose; closed mouth; and widely spaced strands of hair hanging down to shoulder length. The downward position of the head results in the chin line thrusting into the neck, which is hidden by a pointed shirt collar. Top and bottom horizontal lines and a vertical line on the left frame the head.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Male Head, Bowed to Right".
12.7 x 15.4 cm (5 x 6 in.). Gift of Ellen Gustav Jensen. 1956-47-125.
